question.text: My cousin was very ___ when he got the job.

answer.explanation: (B) “Someone else surprised Mr. Hopper”; use the past participle. Choice (A) is the simple form. Choice (C) is the present participle. Choice (D) is the present tense.

question.text: The computer operators work at night ___ on weekends.

answer.explanation: (D) “And” joins equal terms. Choice (A) needs neither after the verb. Choice (B) implies a contrast. Choice (C) is used with “nor”.

question.text: We___finish this work soon because the deadline is approaching.

answer.explanation: (C) “Have to” plus the base form of a verb indicates necessity. Choices (A) and (D) lack the word “to”. Choice (B) is past tense so cannot be used in this sentence about the present.

question.text: This___is very important, so think it over carefully.

answer.explanation: (C) A noun is required to act as the subject of the sentence. Choice (A) is an adverb. Choice (B) is an adjective. Choice (D) is a verb.

question.text: ___off the lights before you leave the office.

answer.explanation: (A) This is an imperative verb, telling the listener what to do. Choice (B) is past tense. Choice (C) is present participle or a gerund. Choice (D) is future tense.

question.text: The new rug looks very nice___that table.

answer.explanation: (D) This is a preposition of place describing the position of the rug. Choices (A) and (B) are nouns. Choice (C) is an adverb.

question.text: The books that he recommended___not very interesting.

answer.explanation: (B) “Were” agrees with the plural noun “books”. Choices (A) and (C) are singular. Choice (D) is an auxiliary verb and cannot be used without a main verb.

question.text: Mr. Kim is not a particularly interesting speaker, and several people fell asleep___his lecture.

answer.explanation: (D) “During” is a preposition, placed before a noun, describing when the people fell asleep. Choices (A), (B), and (C) are used to introduce a clause.

question.text: Our business is rapidly___and we are hiring many new people.

answer.explanation: (C) The present participle form is needed to complete the present continuous verb “is expanding”. Choices (A) and (B) are simple present tense. Choice (D) is present perfect.

question.text: The building___during the heavy thunderstorm last night.

answer.explanation: (C) The subject of the sentence, “the building”, received the action, so a passive- voice verb is required. Choices (A), (B), and (D) are all active-voice forms.
